finding: The Liu-Hui-Wen model predicts that 15-30% of the world's population will be infected with COVID-19, with the majority of infections occurring in Asia.
The COVID-19 pandemic has led to a significant increase in demand for laboratory services, including testing for COVID-19 and other infectious diseases.

The global laboratory network has been strengthened in response to the pandemic, with interconnected systems for rapid detection and containment of emerging threats, as well as for reassuring the public that it is safe to resume daily living activities.

The pandemic has highlighted the importance of laboratory-based disease surveillance and response, as well as for restoring public confidence that postal and other facilities are not contaminated with COVID-19.

The pandemic has also underscored the need for continued and expanded partnerships between laboratories, government agencies, and other organizations for strategic discussions on how best to meet the overarching goals of "prevent, detect, and respond".
